hiw_meta_title: How Auto Rigging Works â€” Complete Character Rigging Pipeline
hiw_hero_lead: An automated pipeline for preparing 3D models: the user uploads a model and receives a production-ready character. The system performs all technical steps â€” from initial normalization and body part detection to rigging, skinning, animation preparation, and final export, including Unity HDRP package and realistic video preview.
hiw_product_desc: The pipeline is designed for batch processing and repeatable results: it removes the need for users to understand the technical details of rigging and engine assembly, turning model upload into a simple "input â†’ ready output" service.
hiw_product_highlight: Upload your model and get a fully prepared character ready for production use.
hiw_formats_desc: The system automatically recognizes the format, correctly imports it, and brings it to a unified working state so that further stages are performed stably and identically.
hiw_openpose_desc: One of the key elements of quality is automatic detection of character reference points using OpenPose. The system can work with up to 137 markers:
hiw_openpose_humanoid: Automatic detection works best on humanoid forms (characters with familiar anatomy): in this case, the pipeline most confidently determines limbs, hands, and proportions, which directly improves the quality of subsequent rigging and deformations.
hiw_tpose_title: Automatic Model Preparation for Correct T-Pose
hiw_tpose_intro: For the automatic rig to be created correctly and produce predictable deformations, the pipeline prepares the model and brings it to a technically correct state:
hiw_tpose_orientation: Model orientation: normalization of "forward/up" direction, bringing to correct position relative to scene axes so that rigging, animations, and engine export work without surprises.
hiw_tpose_scale: Scale and unit auto-check: the system verifies correct scale and brings the model to expected units so the character has the right size, animations don't look "sped up/slowed down" due to scale.
hiw_tpose_limbs: Leg and arm position correction: adjusting the pose toward cleaner T-pose logic. Important for stable joint detection, correct segment lengths, and quality skinning.
hiw_tpose_fingers: Finger detection and preparation: separate work with hands to improve finger rig accuracy and reduce deformation artifacts during animation.
hiw_tpose_result: Result: the model becomes "ready for rigging": correctly oriented, at the right scale, and in a pose suitable for automatic skeleton construction.
hiw_skeleton_intro: After preparation, the pipeline automatically performs the key technical part:
hiw_skeleton_create_desc: A bone structure is formed for the main body parts (spine, legs, arms, head), with correct connections and hierarchy.
hiw_skinning_auto_desc: Vertex weights are distributed across bones so that when the skeleton moves, the model deforms naturally without "breaking".
hiw_skeleton_result: This transforms a static model into a fully animatable character without manual routine work.
hiw_animations_intro: The pipeline delivers results in two forms to cover different workflows:
hiw_baked_desc: Ready for import into game engines. Convenient format for game project integration: clips play back stably and predictably.
hiw_controlrig_desc: Fully suitable for manual animation in Blender. Important if you need to manually adjust pose/movement, create unique animation for a task, or quickly make artistic edits without rebuilding the entire pipeline.
hiw_animations_result: The system supports both the "production" path (engines) and the "artistic" path (manual animation).
hiw_unity_intro: For Unity, the pipeline creates a unitypackage ready for use in Unity HDRP projects:
hiw_unity_1: Model and animations prepared for correct import
hiw_unity_2: Materials and textures brought to HDRP-render compatible form
hiw_unity_3: Result is convenient to connect to projects without manual assembly and lengthy setup
hiw_unity_result: This reduces integration time and decreases typical errors when transferring a character to Unity.
hiw_video_intro: After assembly, the system automatically creates a realistic video:
hiw_video_1: Shows the final character appearance with correct lighting and materials
hiw_video_2: Shows how the rig and deformations work in motion
hiw_video_3: Quick quality assessment without manual scene and render setup
hiw_video_result: Video serves as quick quality control of the final assembly: it's clear what came out "at the output" and where refinement is needed if necessary.

hiw_roadmap_2: Selection and application of specific animation to processed model
hiw_roadmap_3: Automatic export to Unreal and other game engines
